description: Enterprise version of standard coldstart trap featuring
device identification information. A coldStart trap
signifies that the sending protocol entity is reinitializing
itself such that the agent's configuration or the protocol
entity implementation may be altered.

event.Summary: Enterprise version of standard coldstart event

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGenColdStartEvent AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventStdSeverity i 1 AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventDateTime s EXAMPLEE AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventDevID s EXAMPLEEXA SNMPv2-MIB::sysDescr s EXAMPLE

description: Severity of the event that has occurred.
The event severity depends upon the type of
entity/notification that the operational state change event
relates to. The severity values that are normally used are
detailed below:
The enterprise versions of standard SNMP traps all have a
severity of major (4).
GenAppEvents:
Severity depends on event condition
crash - severity is critical (3)
variables.name: AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventStdSeverity

description: Date and time of the occurence of the event.
variables.name: AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventDateTime

description: A unique textual identifier of the alarming device.
variables.name: AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventDevID

description: A textual description of the entity. This value should
include the full name and version identification of
the system's hardware type, software operating-system
and networking software.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysDescr

description: Enterprise version of standard warmstart trap featuring
device identification information. A warmStart trap
signifies that the sending protocol entity is reinitializing
that neither the agent configuration nor the protocol entity
implementation is altered.

event.Summary: Enterprise version of standard warmstart event

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGenWarmStartEvent AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventStdSeverity i 1 AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventDateTime s EXAMPLEE AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventDevID s EXAMPLEEXA SNMPv2-MIB::sysDescr s EXAMPLE

variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysDescr

description: Enterprise version of standard linkDown trap featuring device
identification information. A linkDown trap signifies that
the sending protocol entity recognizes a failure in one of
the communication links represented in the agent's
configuration.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGenLinkDownEvent AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventStdSeverity i 1 AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventDateTime s EXAMPLEE AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventDevID s EXAMPLEEXA SNMPv2-MIB::sysDescr s EXAMPLE IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999

description: Severity of the event that has occurred.
The event severity depends upon the type of
entity/notification that the operational state change event

detailed below:
The enterprise versions of standard SNMP traps all have a
severity of major (4).
GenAppEvents:
Severity depends on event condition
crash - severity is critical (3)

variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysDescr

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: Enterprise version of standard linkUp trap featuring device
identification information. A linkUp trap signifies that the
sending protocol entity recognizes that one of the
communication links represented in the agent's configuration
has come up.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGenLinkUpEvent AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventStdSeverity i 1 AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventDateTime s EXAMPLEE AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventDevID s EXAMPLEEXA SNMPv2-MIB::sysDescr s EXAMPLE IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999

variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: Enterprise version of standard authenticationFailure trap
featuring device identification information. An
authenticationFailure trap signifies that the sending
protocol entity is the addressee of a protocol message that
is not properly authenticated. While implementations of the
SNMP must be capable of generating this trap, they must also
be capable of suppressing the emission of such traps via an
implementation- specific mechanism.

event.Summary: Enterprise version of standard authentication failed

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGenAuthFailureEvent AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventStdSeverity i 1 AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventDateTime s EXAMPLEE AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventDevID s EXAMPLEEXA SNMPv2-MIB::sysDescr s EXAMPLE

variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysDescr

description: A smepGenAppEvent notification is generated whenever a
application entity of the SME Embedded Platform experiences an
event. It signifies that the SNMP entity, acting as a proxy
for the application, has detected an event on the application
entity.
The event severity varies dependent upon the event condition.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGenAppEvent AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventStdSeverity i 1 AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventDateTime s EXAMPLEE AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventDevID s EXAMPLEEXA SNMPv2-MIB::sysDescr s EXAMPLE AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventAppEntity i 1 AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventAppEvent i 1

description: Severity of the event that has occurred.
The event severity depends upon the type of
entity/notification that the operational state change event
relates to. The severity values that are normally used are
detailed below:
The enterprise versions of standard SNMP traps all have a
severity of major (4).
GenAppEvents:
Severity depends on event condition
crash - severity is critical (3)
variables.name: AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventStdSeverity

description: Date and time of the occurence of the event.
variables.name: AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventDateTime

description: A unique textual identifier of the alarming device.

description: A textual description of the entity. This value should
include the full name and version identification of
the system's hardware type, software operating-system
and networking software.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysDescr

description: The SME Embedded Platform application to which a
notification/trap relates.
variables.name: AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventAppEntity

description: SME Embedded Platform application event states. The
associated event severity of the notification/trap the object
is carried in varies depending upon the event condition. The
appropriate severity is detailed against event enumeration.
variables.name: AV-SME-PLATFORM-MIB::smepGTEventAppEvent
